intro: Nauclea cumingiana, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces small, elliptical fruits that contain several seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display. Nauclea cumingiana thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
